meanings.definition: Resembling a small feather or pinna.
meanings.sent1: The pinnular design on the dress looked like tiny feathers.
meanings.sent2: Her earrings had a pinnular shape, similar to small feathers.
meanings.sent3: The pinnular pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel light and airy.
meanings.sent4: The pinnular clouds in the sky floated gracefully like delicate feathers.
meanings.sent5: The pinnular texture of the fabric was soft and delicate to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having the shape of a pinna.
meanings.sent1: The pinnular leaves of the plant resembled the shape of a pinna.
meanings.sent2: The seashell had a pinnular curve that reminded her of a pinna.
meanings.sent3: The pinnular shadow on the wall looked like a giant ear.
meanings.sent4: The pinnular waves of the ocean crashed against the shore with a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The pinnular outline of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to pinnae.
meanings.sent1: The pinnular structure of the building incorporated elements inspired by pinnae.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace was adorned with pinnular charms representing different pinnae.
meanings.sent3: The pinnular decorations in the garden added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: The pinnular details in the painting highlighted the beauty of nature's pinnae.
meanings.sent5: The pinnular patterns on the pottery were reminiscent of intricate pinnae designs.
